description: Sum of first n terms of A_n (using absolute values of terms).
comments: Since the sequences in the OEIS occasionally change their initial terms (for editorial reasons), this is an especially ill-defined sequence! - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 01 2005
example: A000001 (Number of groups of order n) begins 1,... -> a(1)= 1A000002 (Kolakoski sequence) begins 1,2,... -> a(2)= 3A000003 begins 1,1,1,... -> a(3)= 3A000004 (The zero sequence) begins 0,0,0,0,... -> a(4)= 0A000005 (The number of divisors) begins 1,2,2,3,2,... -> a(5)=10A000009 begins 1,1,2,2,4,2,6,4,6,... so a(9) = 1+1+2+2+4+2+6+4+6 = 28.
crossrefs: Cf. A031135, A031214, A100543 (uses signed values).
author: _Russ Cox_
extensions: Corrected and extended by C. Ronaldo (aga_new_ac(AT)hotmail.com), Dec 27 2004
